metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7976 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ntpq saveconfig command in NTP 4.1.2, 4.2.x before 4.2.8p6, 4.3, 4.3.25, 4.3.70, and 4.3.77 does not properly filter special characters, which allows attackers to cause unspecified impact via a crafted filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> unfixed in debian and fedora

criterions.comment: ntp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p4+dfsg-3ubuntu5.3').
